iati-activity.title: WaterAid Pakistan
iati-activity.description: WaterAid has been working in Pakistan for nearly two decades. Initially, focus was on water and sanitation projects in remote rural areas, but WaterAid now also works in the sprawling slums surrounding Pakistan's urban centres to provide clean water, sanitation and hygiene education.WaterAid has set up a rainwater collection project in the Thar Desert, influenced government in Gujranwala leading to the provision of clean water for 2,500 people and initiated extensive work to include hygiene education in schools.
iati-activity.participating-org: Association for Gender Awareness & Human Empowerment
Association for Water, Applied Education & Renewable Energy
iati-activity.activity-date: Financial year that WaterAid (re)started activities within the country

contact-info.mailing-address: Open data at WaterAid, 47-49 Durham Street, London, SE11 5JD, UK

budget.period-start: Forward looking data for WaterAid's 2012-2013 financial year (1st April to 31st March) are drawn from WaterAid's approved aspirational budgets and are estimates as at March 2013. The actual figures achieved will vary depending on a range of factors including the securing of the funding needed, challenges faced in the countries, etc.
budget.period-end: End of WaterAid 2012-13 financial year (1st April to 31st March)
